author: Staff Reporter
text:
: A young excavator operator died after the excavator was entrapped under tonnes of mud that fell on it at a quarry in Perumbavoor near here on Sunday morning.

Prakasan, 27, from Dindigul in Tamil Nadu could not be saved despite being rushed to Kolenchery Medical Mission Hospital. He died in the afternoon. Sources in Fire and Rescue Service, Perumbavoor said that the incident took place at 9.30 a.m. in S N Granite Quarry at Chinakuzhi, owned by P V Santosh. The excavator was engaged in clearing laterite mud from one side of the quarry when the incident took place. The Fire and Rescue personnel were informed at 10.45 a.m. following which they began rescue efforts with the help of local. “The rescue operation was tricky since there was a deep water-filled quarry on the other side. Our personnel and a few local men clung on to ropes with one hand and engaged in clearing the mud, while another excavator was brought in for help,” the sources said.

The excavator’s cleaner escaped unhurt. Two fire tenders from Perumbavoor and Pattimattom were deployed for the rescue effort, while two ambulances too were brought in.
title: Excavator operator dies in mudslide in Kerala quarry
